intro: Conostegia fragrantissima, commonly known as the sweet-scented sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, small, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. Its fragrant foliage and showy blooms make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Conostegia fragrantissima is also valued for its adaptability to various environmental conditions.
